snippet: Lost in the debate over website glitches and broken promises made by President Obama are people’s lives. Consider this 47-year-old Oregon truck driver.
abstract: Nicholas D Kristof Op-Ed column argues that the real health care crisis in America is the nearly 50 million Americans without insurance, not the botched rollout of the online health insurance exchanges; maintains that for many people, their problem with the health care reform law is that it came too late to save their lives.
lead_paragraph: Lost in the debate over website glitches and broken promises made by President Obama are people’s lives. Consider this 47-year-old Oregon truck driver.
